Clarity.justification: The generated diagram is a sequence diagram, which is a completely different type of diagram compared to the architecture diagram in the ground truth. This makes it difficult for stakeholders to understand the architecture and flow of the system as intended.

Completeness.justification: The generated diagram lacks the architectural components and connections present in the ground truth, such as the data extraction, ingestion, storage, and warehouse components. It instead focuses on a detailed process flow, which is not aligned with the architecture overview.

Consistency.justification: The generated diagram uses a different style and notation (sequence diagram) compared to the architecture diagram in the ground truth. There is no structural or semantic alignment between the two diagrams, leading to inconsistencies in representation.
